skills.name: Memory Processes
skills.fullDescription: Memory processes involve storing information in various mediums and retrieving it when needed. This includes using devices like databases and agendas to both preserve and access data. The emphasis is on both creating and recovering memories.

items.title: Robot with Memory Processes
items.text: A robot with advanced memory can store maps and experiences, enhancing navigation in complex settings like search-and-rescue missions by remembering and adapting to different terrains.

items.title: Robot Lacking Memory Processes
items.text: A basic robot in a factory performs repetitive tasks using fixed instructions without memory capabilities, limiting its ability to adapt or improve over time.

skills.name: Sensorimotor Interaction
skills.shortDescription: Perceiving and manipulating objects using various modalities.
skills.fullDescription: Sensorimotor interaction involves the ability to perceive objects and patterns and manipulate them in physical and virtual environments using limbs or actuators. This skill incorporates advanced technologies and techniques adapted for complex environments and different sensory inputs.

items.title: Robot with Sensorimotor Interaction
items.text: An autonomous robot in disaster zones uses tactile and ultrasonic sensors to navigate and manipulate objects, showcasing its capability to adapt and interact dynamically with its environment.

items.title: Robot Lacking Sensorimotor Interaction
items.text: A factory conveyor belt robot moves items along fixed paths and lacks the ability to adapt or respond to environmental changes, demonstrating limited sensorimotor interaction.

skills.name: Visual Processing
skills.fullDescription: Visual processing involves recognizing objects, symbols, and movements in various conditions, adjusting to noise and changes in perspective. This skill is essential for navigating and interacting with different environments, crucial for both robots and humans.

items.title: Robot with Visual Processing
items.text: An autonomous vehicle navigates roads by interpreting traffic signs, signals, and road conditions in real-time, demonstrating its ability to process complex visual data and react appropriately under different lighting and weather conditions.

items.title: Robot Lacking Visual Processing
items.text: An industrial robot in a factory follows fixed instructions without adapting to visual changes, unable to detect variations in parts or respond to visual cues, limiting its functionality in dynamic settings.

skills.name: Auditory Processing
skills.fullDescription: Auditory processing involves interpreting sounds such as speech and music in noisy settings, recognizing sound patterns, alarms, and speech across frequencies. It’s key for effective communication and interaction, focusing on sound identification without fully understanding complex sentences or music perception.

items.title: Robot with Auditory Processing
items.text: A service robot in an airport distinguishes between announcements, commands, and alarms despite background noise. It prioritizes relevant auditory cues to assist travelers, demonstrating robust sound recognition in busy environments.

items.title: Robot Lacking Auditory Processing
items.text: An automation robot in a factory works with consistent noise levels, lacking the capability to identify or respond to auditory changes. Its inability to process verbal commands or alarms limits its adaptability in interactive or changing settings.

skills.name: Planning, Sequential Decision-Making and Acting
skills.shortDescription: Forecasting outcomes to choose optimal actions.
skills.fullDescription: This skill involves forecasting the consequences of actions and deciding the best response in predictable situations. It emphasizes planning actions and making decisions based on sequences and dependencies.

items.title: Robot with Planning Capability
items.text: A disaster relief robot plans rescue operations by evaluating safety, time, and resource constraints, optimizing task sequences in unpredictable environments.

items.title: Robot Lacking Planning Capability
items.text: A robotic vacuum cleaner operates on simple, predefined paths without adapting to new obstacles, demonstrating limited decision-making skills.

skills.name: Comprehension and Expression
skills.fullDescription: This skill involves grasping and communicating complex ideas in various formats, including text and speech. It includes interpreting and summarizing semantic content as well as generating coherent narratives or responses, moving beyond simple phrase recognition to involve deeper understanding and creative expression.

items.title: Robot with Comprehension and Expression Capabilities
items.text: An AI storytelling robot understands and creates narratives, interpreting themes from input stories and generating new ones that resonate with listeners, showcasing its advanced comprehension and creative expression.

items.title: Robot Lacking Comprehension and Expression Capabilities
items.text: A chatbot with fixed responses fails to understand or generate new content, limited to predefined answers without adapting to new conversational contexts, highlighting its restricted comprehension and expression.

skills.name: Communication
skills.shortDescription: Effective information exchange across various channels.
skills.fullDescription: Communication entails exchanging information effectively, understanding message content, and utilizing various channels and protocols. This skill focuses on ensuring messages are clearly sent, received, and understood, covering different communication styles and adapting to the needs of the conversation rather than the narrative content.

items.title: Entity with Effective Communication Skills
items.text: A customer service AI effectively communicates across text, voice, and visual channels, adjusting its interaction style to ensure clarity and understanding, demonstrating its adaptability and proficiency in handling complex inquiries.

items.title: Entity Lacking Communication Skills
items.text: A basic notification system sends alerts via only one channel, ignoring user preferences and context, leading to potential misunderstandings or ignored messages due to its rigid communication approach.

skills.name: Emotion and Self-Control
skills.shortDescription: Managing one's emotions and understanding others'.
skills.fullDescription: This skill involves recognizing and regulating emotions in oneself and others. It includes identifying genuine emotions, responding appropriately, and controlling impulses as needed. The focus is on the direct management of emotions and self-control, excluding broader social and anticipatory aspects.

items.title: Entity with Emotion and Self-Control Capabilities
items.text: An AI therapy robot discerns and reacts to users’ emotional states with suitable empathy and advice, maintaining a calm demeanor, exemplifying effective emotional understanding and self-control in therapeutic contexts.

items.title: Entity Lacking Emotion and Self-Control
items.text: A traditional industrial robot operates without recognizing or adapting to emotions, showing its incapacity for tasks requiring emotional intelligence and response modulation.

skills.name: Navigation
skills.fullDescription: Navigation entails the ability to move oneself or objects across different settings using concepts of location and direction. It involves utilizing tools like GPS and landmarks to find safe and efficient routes, while adapting to environmental changes and obstacles.

items.title: Entity with Navigation Capability
items.text: An autonomous delivery drone navigates using GPS and computer vision to avoid obstacles and optimize routes, demonstrating the ability to efficiently and safely travel through complex environments.

items.title: Entity Lacking Navigation Capability
items.text: A stationary manufacturing robot, confined to a specific area, cannot relocate or navigate different spaces, highlighting its limited functionality compared to mobile robots.

skills.name: Conceptualization, Learning, and Abstraction
skills.shortDescription: Building knowledge and generalizing from examples.
skills.fullDescription: This skill involves generalizing from examples, learning from instructions, and developing knowledge at varying levels of abstraction. It requires creating and applying new insights beyond existing knowledge to enhance task performance effectively.

items.title: Entity with Conceptualization, Learning, and Abstraction Capabilities
items.text: An NLP machine learning algorithm exemplifies this skill by learning from new language inputs to refine its understanding of grammar and syntax, continuously improving its language processing and generation abilities.

items.title: Entity Lacking Conceptualization, Learning, and Abstraction
items.text: A basic calculator operates with fixed rules and lacks the ability to learn or adapt, confined to the specific arithmetic operations it was programmed to execute.

skills.name: Quantitative and Logical Reasoning
skills.shortDescription: Analyzing data to derive insights and conclusions.
skills.fullDescription: This skill involves analyzing quantitative or logical data to infer new insights, handling probabilities, counterfactuals, and analytical reasoning. It goes beyond simple rule application, actively engaging with information to solve problems by generating conclusions, identifying inconsistencies, and resolving fallacies.

items.title: Entity with Quantitative and Logical Reasoning Capabilities
items.text: An AI in financial analysis uses quantitative models and logical reasoning to forecast market trends, synthesizing complex data to predict future movements and identify investment opportunities.

items.title: Entity Lacking Quantitative and Logical Reasoning
items.text: A digital clock displays time accurately but lacks the capability to reason beyond its basic functions, unable to interpret or predict based on the data it displays.

skills.name: Metacognition and Confidence Assessment
skills.fullDescription: Metacognition and confidence assessment involve evaluating one's own reliability, capabilities, and limitations. It includes assessing the success probability of actions and knowing when to delegate based on one’s competencies. This skill extends beyond mere action selection, incorporating the ability to gauge and apply confidence accurately in decision-making processes.

items.title: Entity with Metacognition and Confidence Assessment Capabilities
items.text: A self-driving car's navigation system exemplifies this skill by continuously evaluating its sensor reliability and algorithm effectiveness, deciding when to seek human intervention based on confidence in its capabilities.

items.title: Entity Lacking Metacognition and Confidence Assessment
items.text: A robotic vacuum follows set routines without the capacity to assess its performance or adapt decisions based on its limitations, demonstrating a lack of metacognitive abilities.
